com.mousebird.maply

Class GeometryRaw

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mousebird.maply.GeometryRaw

  • public class GeometryRaw
extends java.lang.Object
    Raw Geometry object. Collection of points and triangles.

    • Method Detail

      • valid

        public boolean valid()
        Returns true if the raw geometry object is valid. Checks that the number of points, normals, and texture coordinates matches.

      • setTypeNative

        public void setTypeNative(int type)

      • setType

        public void setType(GeometryRaw.GeometryType type)
        Set the geometry type. Can be lines or triangles.

      • setTexture

        public void setTexture(MaplyTexture tex)
        Apply a texture to the geometry.

      • setTextureNative

        public void setTextureNative(long texID)

      • addPoints

        public void addPoints(double[] pts)
        Add a group of points at once.
        Parameters:
        pts - Points are organized as X,Y,Z in order.
        numPts - Number of points

      • addNorms

        public void addNorms(double[] norms)
        Add a group of normals at once.
        Parameters:
        norms - Norms are organized as X,Y,Z in order.
        numNorms - Number of normals

      • addTexCoords

        public void addTexCoords(float[] texCoords)
        Add a group of texture coordinates.
        Parameters:
        texCoords - Texture coordinates are organized as u,v.
        numTexCoords - Number of texture coordinates.

      • addColors

        public void addColors(int[] colors)
        Add a group of colors.
        Parameters:
        colors - Individual colors as 32 bit values.
        numColors - Number of colors.

      • addTriangles

        public void addTriangles(int[] tris)
        Add a group of triangles. Indices refer to vertices in order.
        Parameters:
        tris - Triangles are organized as three vertices per triangle.
        numTris - Number of triangles.

      • finalize

        public void finalize()
        Overrides:
        finalize in class java.lang.Object
